result.execSummary:
The defendant Marquita Denise Sheffel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Marquita Denise Sheffel is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Marquita Denise Sheffel was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant to pay today.
DNA surcharge.
Defendant to submit a DNA sample at the Jail.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marquita Denise Sheffel

TO ALSO INCLUDE 15CM264 and 15CM759:
CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle. ADA:  Michael Edward Nieskes   DF ATTY:  Jeremiah James Harrelson   DF:  Marquita Denise Sheffel appeared. Case called at 9:42 a.m. Court notes Atty Harrelson filed motions on 15CM759. There is a resolution on 15CM264. On file 15CM264, Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads GUILTY to amended Ct 1 without domestic abuse assessments in 15CM264 . DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of amended Ct 1 without domestic abuse assessments in 15CM264. On motion of the State, Crt dismisses Ct 2 in 15CM264. Sentencing arguments. Crt orders:

- Costs of $114.50

- DNA Sample and Surcharge
Pre-trial conference at 02-10-2016 09:30 am
